item.title: kafka
item.description: the following is a review of kafka on the shore by haruki murakami kafka on the shore is something of a coming-of-age novel following two separate storylines: a child named kafka who is trying to escape an oedipus-esque curse, and an old man named nakata who is… kind of just living life after losing most of his mental faculties in an accident. the book is structured with chapters alternating between these two characters’ perspectives.
